column4: Can one machine on a wireless network act as a DHCP server for another machine hooked up to it via ethernet?
yes but why would you want it to?
im trying to pxe install ubuntu on to a client machine, and all i have is my laptop with wifi and an ethernet cable (no network on ethernet)
what do you mean it "cant find it"
how do you have wifi access?
I can't (dont know how) to access a wireless connection using just bios from the client
where are you getting your wifi access from? what type of access point?
from what type of access point? router? repeater?
you cant connect the 'client' to the router?
so you dont have physical access to the router?
aigy: not sure how I missed that.. I though it was just a internet sharing thing lol..
